name: NAMASTE_to_TM2
description: Mapping NAMASTE terms to WHO TM2 terms

extension.shortDefinition: Neurotrophic Ulcer due to Increased vali
extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by a type of ulcer caused by abcess with reddishblack coloured pus discharge. It is explained by increased vali. Amoung the seven udal thathukkal Cāram, Cennīr gets affected.

extension.shortDefinition: Pricking pain around the head due to increasing Vali
extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by pricking pain around the head with severe pain in the occipital region. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by numbness and smoothness of the foot, pain all over the body, restricted movements of the spine. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

target.display: Weakness of thighs due to vata

extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by vali accumulated in the affected areas, heaviness present in the upper limbs, pricking pain, heaviness of head. It is explained by increased vali along with aaiyam. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by shivering, insomnia, body is full of flatness, glued hands, dryness of skin and mouth. It is explained by increased vali along with Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ, Koẕuppu and Eṉpu gets affected.

target.display: Peripheral neuritis due to derangement of Vaḷi

extension.shortDefinition: Peripheral Neuritis due to vit B1deficiency
extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by excessive sense of smell, increased appetite, physically active, giddiness. It is explained by increased vali and Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram and Cennīr gets affected.

It is characterized by inability to move, increased pain in the body, seizure, excessive sweat, dryness. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by inability of movements, unable to swallow, excessive salivation, unable to inflate, unable to do anything properly. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ gets affected.

It is characterized by the symptoms like loss of wrinkling, unable to frown, tremble present in the head, sometimes body become cool, fatigue, weakness, dullness. It is explained by increased aiyam along with vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Ce

It is characterized by uncomfortable feeling throughout the body, restricted movements, unable to open eyes, tendency of biting, excessive salivation, body looks like corpse. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr,

It is characterized by pain present all over the body, feeling of sadness, having the qualities like respecting elders, stands on the side of bad qualities, sunken eyes, patient falls due to unconscious, but physically fit. It is explained by increased va

It is characterized by pain in the neck radiating up to upper limbs, restricted movements, loss of hearing, loss of memories, sleep, and heaviness of head. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr, Ūṉ and Koẕuppu gets

extension.shortDefinition: Vatham aggrevation with stammering and impotence
extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by pain present in the node due to excersice speech, pain present in the fore head, unasle to speak properly, loss of appetite. It is explained by increased vali and Aẕal. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ all seven gets affected.

It is characterized by headache, like splitting the head, blinking eyes due to burning sensation, shivering, loss of appetite, loss of hair. It is explained by increased vali. Among the seven Uṭaṟtātukkaḷ Cāram, Cennīr and Ūṉ, gets affected.

It is characterized by burning sensation present in the lower thigh, sole of both legs, eyes and palms, dryness in both nostrils and ears, numbness in the back and in both legs and hands, burning sensation is unbearable and so the person will very much

It is characterized by bitter tasting vomiting, cough, sleeplessness, excessive salivation and dribbling of saliva over the chest. The head, forehead, back of the head and spine will feel hot with shivering. It is explained by increased Aẕal and vali. A

It is characterized by syncope, pricking pain in the stomach, vomiting occurs every morning, even in sleep, consciousness will be present without any change, body will be tired, the patient will always be adamant in his attitude. There will be p

target.display: Three humours affected leading to seizure

extension.shortDefinition: Three humours affected leading to Seizure.
extension.longDefinition: It is characterised by dryness of the tongue with blackish discoloration, fever with burning sensation, generalised seizures, loss of vigour, poor memory, the muscles have spasms that jerks seen in jaw, cheeks, ear, eyebrows, nose and vertex. It is expl
A type of severe headache which involves one half of head whether it is right or left. It is an episodic type of pain accompanied with nausea and vomiting.
A type of migraine which is caused by predominance of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile) and Dam (blood/sanguine) in the body.
A type of migraine which is caused by predominance of Balgham (phlegm) and Sawdā’ (black bile) in the body.

Sadr is a disease of brain in which the person experiences darkness on standing. This condition usually accompanies with heaviness of head, tinnitus and confusion. Duwār is similar to Sadr but in this condition the patients feel giddiness also.

target.display: Vertigo and giddiness due to Dam

extension.longDefinition: A type of vertigo and giddiness caused by the accumulation of Dam (blood /sanguine) in the brain itself. It is characterized by frequent episodes of giddiness, flushing of face, redness of eyes and elevated temperature of head. Initially, it is accompanied with lacrimation.

target.display: Vertigo and giddiness due to Balgham

extension.longDefinition: Mostly it occurs due to the accumulation of Balgham (phlegm) in the brain. It is characterized by vertigo and giddiness along with heaviness of head, increased salivation, decreased thirst, altered sensorium, increased sleep and pulsus mollis.

target.display: Vertigo and giddiness due to Ṣafrā’

extension.longDefinition: A type of vertigo and giddiness caused by the accumulation of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile) in the brain. It is characterized by vertigo and giddiness along with pale face, bitter taste, pulsus velox and thirst.

target.display: Vertigo and giddiness due to Sawdā’

extension.longDefinition: A type of vertigo and giddiness caused by the accumulation of Sawdā’ (black bile) in the brain. It is characterized by excessive thoughts and sleeplessness, pulsus debilis and pulses durus.
The state of Sadr and Duwār which comes as a complication of some other systemic diseases.

Its literal meaning is to fall down. It is an episodic disease in which sensory and motor functions of the organs are stopped. The patient falls down and experiences convulsions and frothing from the mouth.

target.display: Epilepsy due to derangement of Sawdā’

extension.longDefinition: A type of Ṣar‘ caused by the obstruction of ventricles of brain by the thick black bile which causes hindrance in the flow of motor faculties and psychic pneuma with in the related nerves.

A condition that occurs when there is a complete obstruction of the ventricles of the brain and channels of oxygen. In this condition the motor and sensory functions of the body stop but the respiratory and circulatory functions remain active. Patient remains stationary.
A type of apoplexy that occurs due to Sudda Balghamī (phlegmatic obstruction) in the brain. In this condition patient develops palor, flaccid muscles and there is discharge from nose and mouth.
A type of apoplexy that occurs due to accumulation of Sawdā’ (black bile) in the brain.
Paralytic conditions where muscles of half body (longitudinally) on either side stop functioning except the head.
A condition in which muscles contract towards their origin. It is a state of muscular spasm.

It is the weakness of brain. In this condition the blood supply to whole brain or a part of brain is interrupted and that part or the whole brain does not get sufficient supply of blood leading to the disturbance in different faculties of brain. This condition can also be due to impaired temperament of brain, congenital abnormality of brain, increased Istifrāgh (evacuation) of the body by any method.
Pain felt in the head which is divided into many types according to cause.
Headache on exposure to hot environment. This headache does not involve Mādda (organic matter) or any pathological change inside the body.
Headache on exposure to cold environment without involvement of Mādda (organic matter).

target.display: Headache due to derangement of Dam

extension.longDefinition: Headache due to predominance of Dam (blood/sanguine).

target.display: Headache due to derangement of Balgham

extension.longDefinition: Headache due to predominance of Balgham (phlegm).

target.display: Headache due to derangement of Ṣafrā’

extension.longDefinition: Headache due to predominance of Ṣafrā’ (yellow bile).

target.display: Headache due to derangement of Sawdā’

extension.longDefinition: Headache due to predominance of Sawdā’ (black bile).
Headache due to the accumulation of gases in the brain that are produced in the body.
Headache due to accumulation of gases in the brain from outside the body.
Headache due to excessive production of gases inside the brain.
Headache due to excessive production of gases outside the brain.
Headache due to Waram (inflammation) of brain.
Headache due to increased pulsation of arteries in the brain.

target.display: Headache due to weakness of brain

extension.shortDefinition: Headache due to weakness of brain
extension.longDefinition: Headache due to weakness of brain.
Headache due to inhalation of pungent odour or strong smells.

target.display: Referred headache due to the involvement of the stomach

extension.shortDefinition: Referred headache due to the involvement of the stomach
extension.longDefinition: Headache due to stomach diseases.

target.display: Referred headache due to the involvement of the liver

extension.shortDefinition: Referred headache due to the involvement of the liver
extension.longDefinition: Headache due to liver diseases.

target.display: Referred headache due to the involvement of the peritoneum

extension.shortDefinition: Referred Headache due to the involvement of the peritoneum
extension.longDefinition: Headache due to involvement of peritoneum.
Headache due to catarrh.
A type of tension occurring at both ends of the muscles causing maximum stretching of the muscles.

A disease of the facial muscles in which face is deviated to either side. In this condition patient cannot close his eyes on the affected side and lips, completely. Saliva continues to dribble from the angles of the mouth. When the patient blows, air comes out from one side of the mouth. When this disease is bilateral there is no deviation of face but lips and eyes do not close completely.

target.display: Deviation of one side of face due to flaccidity of muscles

extension.shortDefinition: deviation of one side of face due to flaccidity of muscles
extension.longDefinition: Deviation of face due to flaccidity of the facial muscles.

extension.shortDefinition: deviation of one side of face due to spasm of muscles
extension.longDefinition: Deviation of face due to spasm of the facial muscles.
Shivering of the organs of the body due to the weakness or defect in motor system. It is a mixture of voluntary and involuntary movements of the body.

target.display: Tremor due to cold impaired temperament

extension.shortDefinition: tremor due to cold morbid temperament
extension.longDefinition: A type of Ra‘sha caused by simple cold morbid temperament of the organ.

The complete/partial loss of sensation of any organ of the body. According to causes it can be of four types i. e. Balghamī (phlegmatic), Damawī (sanguineous), Sawdāwī (melancholic) and Ṣafrāwī (bilious).

A severe type of pain of throat which is produced by spasm of nerves and vessels of the neck. If it is due to the spasm of arteries then it is fatal. If the cause is the spasm of nerves then it is not fatal.

A condition of severe chronic continuous headache caused by the predominance of sanguine humour. This condition is characterised by redness of face and other features of predominance of sanguine along with specific clinical features of helmet headache

A condition of paralysis of lower part of body due to constitution derangement in spinal cord resulting from any injury or its inflammation. It can also be due to congestion of Dam. It is characterised by gradual weakness of muscles of lower limbs, backache, staggering gait, occasional fall followed by the stoppage of motor functions of lower limb.
A speech disorder involving frequent problems with the normal fluency and flow of speech.
It is characterized by a swelling with pus collection, redness, pain, warmth, and swelling. It is explained by increased Aṣal...
It is characterized by a liver abcess with breathlessness, pain in the thoracic region...
It is characterized by a abcess in the inguinal region with pain, fever...

extension.shortDefinition: abcess in and around the anus
extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by a abcess in and around the anus with painful defication...
It is characterized by small multiple boils present in and around the axillary region...

extension.shortDefinition: Hyperpigmentation of skin in the scalp
extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by hyperpigmented skin lesions in the scalp with dryness, scaliness...

extension.shortDefinition: Thickening of scalp skin due to toxins
extension.longDefinition: It is characterised by coin shaped hyperkeratinised lesions with hyperpigmented dots...
It is characterised by circumscribed hyperplasia, pale or brown coloured naevus...
It is characterised by loss of hair in scalp or body due to malnutrition...
It is characterised by chronic inflammation of pilo sebaceous follicles...
Falling of hair from the anterior portion of the scalp.
Abrupt eruptions of the skin which are reddish in colour with raised margins...
An infection caused by the continous dampening in between the fingers.
Pain of the back can be superficial or deep. It can be due to cold impaired temperament...
A type of pain which originates from the hip joints and runs along with the sciatic nerve...
The ossification of joints and reduced joint spaces leading to locking of the joints.
A type of parasitic disease. It starts with an eruption on the skin of the leg...
In this type of swelling, gas gets accumulated in the spaces of organs...
Acute swelling of the organs characterised by severe clinical features.
A type of movable swelling with varying size from gram seed to watermelon.
Its literal meaning is ‘ant’. These are one or more small red papules...
Eruptions of the skin which are encrusted immediately after appearance...
Collection of fluid in the lymphatic channels due to their obstruction...
Obesity is caused by leading a sedentary life and intake of fatty diets.
Protrusion of an organ or a part of the organ through an abnormal opening...

extension.shortDefinition: Pain in the ears due to aggrevation of aiyam
extension.longDefinition: It is characterized by pain present in both ears...
It is characterized by swelling of major and minor joints...

extension.shortDefinition: Urinary tract Infection caused by increasedAiyam
extension.longDefinition: It is characterised by cystitis,pyuria with feces-like bad odour...
